Definition.WordDefinition:
Intolerant \In*tol"er*ant\ ([i^]n*t[o^]l"[~e]r*ant), a. [L. intolerans, -antis: cf. F. intol['e]rant. See {In-} not, and {Tolerant}.] [1913 Webster] 1. Not enduring; not able to endure. [1913 Webster]
The powers of human bodies being limited and intolerant of excesses. --Arbuthnot. [1913 Webster]
2. Not tolerating difference of opinion or sentiment, especially in religious matters; refusing to allow others the enjoyment of their opinions, rights, or worship; unjustly impatient of the opinion of those disagree with us; not tolerant; unforbearing; bigoted. [1913 Webster]
Religion, harsh, intolerant, austere, Parent of manners like herself severe. --Cowper. [1913 Webster]

Definition.WordDefinition: Intolerant \In*tol"er*ant\, n. An intolerant person; a bigot. [1913 Webster]
intolerant adj 1: unwilling to tolerate difference of opinion [ant: {tolerant}] 2: narrow-minded about cherished opinions [syn: {illiberal}]
